definition[0]: a product that is sold at a very low price in order to attract customers into a shop
definition[1]: a product or service that is sold at a loss, but that is intended to encourage people to buy other, profitable products or services
example[0]: Supermarkets sometimes sell bread as a loss leader to bring in customers for other, more expensive goods.
definition[2]: an activity that loses money but that is hoped to make a profit later
example[1]: Most law firms view Moscow offices as loss leaders that will eventually bring great profits.
